text.citation: Rau, D. V., & Dong, M. N. (2006). Yami texts with reference grammar and dictionary. Institute of Linguistics, Academia Sinica.
text.BibTeX_citation: @book{rau2006yami, title={Yami texts with reference grammar and dictionary}, author={Rau, D Victoria and Dong, Maa-Neu}, year={2006}, publisher={Institute of Linguistics, Academia Sinica}}
text.source: ['1. niomahas a longtsang si Kaojinzhong', '越獄犯高進忠', 'An escaped convict', '', 'si Tonosen (M, 53, Yayo)', '賴金龍，男，53，椰油村', '']

S.FORM: apnezak rana am, ma-níring si Apiasongaran am, ji apen Jinovoya am,
S.TRANSL: 有一天早上，si Apiasongaran對si apen Jinovoya說
In the morning, Si Apiasongaran said to si apen Jinovoya,

S.FORM: “ma-ngay ta ma-ngayo, mo ka-teysa”, “nohon”,
S.TRANSL: “堂哥，我們去砍木柴” ，“好啊”
“Cousin, let’s go cut some wood.” “Okay,” was the reply.

S.FORM: “a mi ko pa mang-ap so zaig ko an” koan na ni apen Jinovoya ito a, mi-ratateng am, ma-ngay rana do vahay da.
S.TRANSL: si apen Jinovoya說“我先回家拿斧頭” 。他就回家去拿（斧頭）了
“I’ll go get the ax,” said si apen Jinovoya. Then he left to get it.

S.FORM: am o sakop na am, abo-o, ta ni-pangay na do alavat na, ka-ji na maka-teneng-an do sakop na ori a,
S.TRANSL: 但si apen Jinovoya沒有看見他的帽子，因為Mikowkow還帶了帽子塞在褲袋裡，所以Jinovoya並不知道這事
Mikowkow had put his hat in his pocket, but Jinovoya didn’t know he had one.

S.FORM: am noka-no-nang na am, ni-om-ahas si Kaojinzhong am,
S.TRANSL: 正好在那個時候，有一名囚犯名叫高進忠的越了獄
Right about that time, an inmate named Kaojinzhong had escaped from the jail.

S.FORM: abo ji ni-ma-niahey a tao-tao do ka-pongso-an ta sia ya,
S.TRANSL: 這使我們島上的人沒有一個是不感到惶恐害怕的
The people living on our island were all shivering with fear,

S.FORM: akmi to man-zakat do nana-nanad, ta ji a-ni-man-zakat si Kaojinzhong so dehdeh sio a,
S.TRANSL: 好像聽說他曾在路上殺過人。他是真的殺了一個外地人
for we had heard that he had once murdered someone on the streets. He had killed a non-local,

S.FORM: mi-ratateng am, ka-pik-ezaz no tao sio a ma-saod no asa ka maattaw ya,
S.TRANSL: 所以我們全島的人都無不感到惶恐不安
so the people of the whole island were terrified.

S.FORM: “a ko na teyka ni-ma-mtek ya, a mo pa ji a-teyka?” koan na si apen Jinovoya ni apen Mikowkow am, “nohon, ko pa ma-mtek”,
S.TRANSL: si apen Mikowkow對si apen Jinovoya說，“我已經捆好[木柴 了，你還沒好嗎?” “哦，我還在捆綁[我的木柴 呢”
Si apen Mikowkow said to si apen Jinovoya, “I have finished bundling wood. Are you finished yet?” “Yes, I am still bundling [my wood right now.”

S.FORM: “a yaken rana am, mi ko pa ma-ngotas so raon namen, ta ya abo o raon namen”, “nohon”, ka-pa-ngota-ngotas na do tey-ngato.
S.TRANSL: “我呢，先去上面採姑婆葉，因為我們家沒有姑婆葉了” ，“好的” ；他就去上面採葉子
“Then I’ll go pick wild taro leaves, because we don’t have any.” “Okay.” And so he left.

S.FORM: teyka ma-mtek si apen Jinovoya so kayo na am, “a mi ko pa ma-ngotas so raon namen”,
S.TRANSL: si apen Jinovoya捆好木柴以後，心想“我也去採姑婆葉好了”
After si apen Jinovoya finished bundling wood, he thought, “I should go pick wild taro leaves also.”

S.FORM: “ana, mo ka-teysa” koan na, am ji mi-zi-ziak, ta am-ian do tey-ngato pa, ji na ami-amizing a, ka-pa-ngotas na,
S.TRANSL: “喂，堂弟！” 他喊道；由於si apen Mikowkow人在很上面的地方採葉子，沒怎麼聽到堂哥在叫他的聲音，所以就沒做任何回應；就只顧著採葉子
He called out, “Yo, cousin Mikowkow!” But because si Mikowkow was too high up, he didn’t hear. He kept picking leaves.

S.FORM: a to na a-mizing o ma-ktokto ni apen Jinovoya am, “a ikong ori o ya ma-ktokto” koan na am,
S.TRANSL: 忽然，si apen Jinovoya聽到敲打的聲音，他說“那敲擊的聲音是什麼？”
Suddenly, si apen Jinovoya heard a banging sound, and he thought, “What is that?”

S.FORM: to na n-ita am, mi-ayob so ayob na ori, “taon a, si ka-teysa ori, ta ya ji mi-ayob so ayob no cikok ori a ka no abtan no cikok ang”,
S.TRANSL: 他往上一看，看見一個穿著囚裝的人，“嗯，是堂弟吧，因為他穿的是中國（囚犯）服和褲子”
He turned to look, saw someone with the clothing of a prisoner, and thought, “Hmm, that should be my cousin, for I remember he had prisoner’s clothing on.”

S.FORM: to na n-ita o oo na am, am m-ire-yre-reket-an do dang a ma-cimoy a, to na n-ita o oo na am, mi-sakop.
S.TRANSL: 當時正下著細雨；他又往頭上看了看，發現他（Mikowkow）戴著帽子。
It was drizzing at the time. He saw the person [Mikowkow had a hat on his head.

W.TRANSL: 動綴-疊-疊-溼答答的-動綴

S.FORM: “wo, si ka-teysa ta, ya ko ni-ma-cita, ya m-ian so sakop na, ori rana ji apen Jinovoya, ka-to na rana ma-layo-an a,
S.TRANSL: si apen Jinovoya心想，“喔！這不可能是堂弟，我沒看見他有帽子啊” 。 就這樣，si apen Jinovoya開始跑
He thought, “Oh! He isn’t cousin Mikowkow. I didn’t see him with a hat on.” Just as this thought crossed his mind, si apen Jinovoya ran away in fear.

S.FORM: ji na rana ng-ap-a o kayo-kayo na, zai-zaig na am, rao-raon na, to rana ma-layo a,
S.TRANSL: 他的木柴，斧頭和葉子等，什麼也不拿了，就只知拼命的跑
The wood, ax, and leaves were all left behind, for his only thought was to get away.

S.FORM: “apia rana ori, ta ji na rana a-ong yaken a, agnoz-en ko rana, ta vahey-in ko rana si Mikowkow a, ta ka-to na a-zakat-an dang,
S.TRANSL: 可以了，他應該追不上我了，我現在要來驚動山區，好讓堂弟si Mikowkow聽到這個警訊，否則他會死在那裡
“I have run far enough, and he shouldn’t be able to catch up, so I must shout in order to let cousin Mikowkow hear, or else he will die.”

S.FORM: “mo ka-teysa!” koan na, “ikongo”, “si Kaojinzhong, mo ka-bagbag, ta na yaten zakat-en”,
S.TRANSL: “堂弟！” 他喊著。“什麼事？” ，“你要死了，高進忠出現了，他來殺我們！”
“Cousin!” he yelled. “What?” “Shit, Kaojinzhong has come to kill us!”

S.FORM: “nona, ya m-ai?” koan na am, ji rana mi-zi-ziak si Mikowkow a, to rana ma-layo a, “ta ya ko ma-zakat” koan na ni Mikowkow am,
S.TRANSL: si Mikowkow心想“喔，他來了？！” 於是si Mikowkow再也不敢出聲，然後就趕緊跑下山去，因為“我就要死掉了” 他想
Si Mikowkow thought, “Oh, Kaojinzhong is coming?” He didn’t dare utter a sound and concentrated on running as fast as he could. “I’ll be dead,” he thought.

S.FORM: ori o ka-palayo na, a mi-onot sira am, ji a-ni-ma-gza si Apiasongaran ito si Koskos ito a, ka-to na ata-atas-an so tey-sa bneng do ka-kezas na,
S.TRANSL: 就這樣，他們兩個一前一後相隨的拼命的跑著。尤其是si Apiasongaran （又名si Koskos, si Mikowkow）更是跑得飛快，每一跨步就好像跨越一塊田 的距離那麼大步
The two of them ran as fast as they could, one in front, one in back. Si Apiasongaran, also called si Koskos [a.k.a. si Mikowkow, ran especially fast, and each step felt like enough to cross a field.

S.FORM: no to na pa-talirong-a ni apen Jinovoya ito o mata na am, to na pa-likey-a am, “mo ka-teysa, key! ta da yaken zakat-en!”
S.TRANSL: si apen Jinovoya每一回頭，就覺得距離愈來愈小；於是他又喊道“堂弟， 快呀，他們要來殺我了！”
Each time si apen Jinovoya turned his head, he would feel the distance had shortened, so he shouted, “Cousin Mikowkow, hasten, he is coming to kill us!”

S.FORM: “nona, ya na zakat-en a, yaken a ya ma-nowji am, ji-abo ka-pi-zi-ziak ko a”, to rana malayo si Mikowkow a,
S.TRANSL: si Mikowkow聽到了就心想“哦，堂哥跑在前頭要被殺了，那我跑在後面的 就更不能出聲了” ，因此就只有默默的跑著
Si Mikowkow heard and thought, “Oh, if cousin si apen Jinovoya, who is in front, is evading death, then it’s all the more reason for me to be quiet,” as he ran on quietly.

S.FORM: to na pa-talirong-a o mata na am, “ana!” koan na am, tang, to na niri-siring-a ni Mikowkow, ta ji a-niahey si Mikowkow, ori o ka-palayo da.
S.TRANSL: si apen Jinovoya眼睛又往後看了一下，喊叫“喂！” 的一聲。喝！si Mikowkow都嚇死了，怎麼會回應他？他只有拼命的跑而已
Jinovoya once again turned and called out, “Hey!” but si Mikowkow, who was in back, was terrified and didn’t dare utter a sound. They just kept on going.

S.FORM: am-ian rana do pi-ci-cingi-an da ito do om-zaong am, “a ji ko na n-ita si cia-bagbag a, ya na ji mi-zi-ziak ori, ala ya na rana ni-zakat si ka-teysa ang” koan na am,
S.TRANSL: 他們一直跑到看得到的那裡do Omzaong時，si apen Jinovoya心想，“該死的，我怎麼可以不把他看清楚一點？他怎麼不再講話？會不會已經把堂弟給殺了？” 他想
They kept on running till they got to Omzaong, where si apen Jinovoya thought, “Damn, why hasn’t he replied yet? He probably had killed my cousin. I must see who is in back of me.”

S.FORM: to na n-ita am, “a síno ori ya kmi si ka-teysa ang?”, to na n-ita am, “ya pa m-ai jiaken, ta o sakop na ito” koan na am
S.TRANSL: 於是就再看一下，“誰呀,怎麼這麼像堂弟？” 再看，“他怎麼還在追我？那個帽子是 ？” 他想（他覺得很納悶又很害怕）。
He took a good look, and thought, “Who is that? Why does he look like cousin Mikowkow?” After a little while, he thought, “He’s still following me. That hat?”

S.FORM: panid na o abo ni apen Jinvoya ito a malayo a.
S.TRANSL: si apen Jinovoya就只差沒有翅膀的又開始拼命的跑了
Si apen Jinovoya got more and more scared, and was just lacking the wings to get away.

S.FORM: a to ko na nodo-todo-a am, “a ya m-ian do likod ko an?” koan na,
S.TRANSL: 於是我（Jinovoya，只有）不斷的指著他的帽子（因喘的說不出話來了）。而他 (Mikowkow) 卻誤會的說“他（高進忠）在我後面（追我）嗎？”
Jinovoya kept on pointing to Mikowkow’s hat. Mikowkow asked, bewildered, “Is he (Kaojinzhong) still behind me?”

S.FORM: “beken” koan na ni apen Jinovoya, to na nodo-todo-a, ta sakop na, “asio o sakop mo ang?” koan na,
S.TRANSL: si apen Jinovoya說“不是！” ，然後還是不斷的指著他的帽子說，“你怎麼有帽子？”
Si apen Jinovoya said, “No,” but kept on pointing at the hat and asked, “where did you get the hat?”

S.FORM: “tang! a ko ni-pangay do alavat ko ito ang”, ha, ha, ha
S.TRANSL: “喝！我（之前）塞在口袋裡的啊” ，哈-哈-哈-
“Heh, I had it in my pocket.” Ha ha ha

S.FORM: ka-pandan da rana nira ori a ni-ma-nanat so velek a, ji mina Kaojinzhong, ta ka-niahey na nia am,
S.TRANSL: 他們兩個因為高進忠的越獄事件，嚇得他們心驚肉跳
The two of them were both terrified by Kaojinzhong’s escape.

S.FORM: “a ya ji galagal si cia-bagbag a, na ji manci-an ya na ka-pi-sakop ang” koan na am.
S.TRANSL: si apen Jinovoya心有餘悸的嘀咕著說“該死的，怎麼都不回應，也不事先告訴我他有帽子！”
“Why didn’t he say something, and why didn’t he tell me he had a hat?” si apen Jinovoya thought, sulking.

S.FORM: tateng am, to sia na neyked do yan-an da, “a ikong o mo ni-ka-ciwciw?”,
S.TRANSL: 後來他們兩個就停下來。Mikowkow問“你是被什麼嚇跑的？”
They stopped running. “What scared you?” Mikowkow asked.

S.FORM: “ya ko i-cingi imo am, ya ka mi-sako-sakop, ya mo ni-pa-cita jiaken o sakop mo noka-pa-ngayo ta ang,
S.TRANSL: “我探頭看你的時候，發現你頭上戴了帽子。我們砍木柴之時,你沒有讓我看到你的帽子。就這樣
“I saw you with a hat and When we went up to cut wood, you didn’t show me you had a hat.”

S.FORM: ya mo ji ma-cita-i no sakop mo mo ka-kma si mina ama mo” koan na am,
S.TRANSL: 你怎麼沒讓我看到你的帽子，你要死啦？” si apen Jinovoya說
Damn you! Why didn’t you show me you had a hat?” si apen Jinovoya asked.

S.FORM: “a koanata, ya ma-cimoy am, ya ji angay o cimoy do oo ko am, ori ya ko ni-pi-sakop rana am, ya ko ni-baba-an sia”,
S.TRANSL: “啊呀，那是因為下雨了嘛，雨水從我的頭上滑落下來（到我臉上），所以我才拿出來戴的啊”
“Well, I only took it out to put on because it was raining. The rain might have fallen on my head.”

S.FORM: mi-ratateng am, m-ównay am, mi sia rana do kayo da am, mi da rana ha-hap-en o ni-pi-wali-walit da rao-raon da am, kayo-kayo da nira,
S.TRANSL: 很久以後，他們再去砍木柴時，才把他們當時匆忙亂甩的姑婆芋葉和木柴一併拿回家
After a long time, they finally went back to pick up the taro leaves and wood they had left behind.

S.FORM: mi-ratateng am, mi sia rana mi-ke-hza am, a ka-tenng-an na si Mikowkow ito a ni-mi-ayob so ayob no longtsang a ka no abtan no longtsang,
S.TRANSL: 後來他們一起出發去了。si apen Jinovoya看到（知道）si Mikowkow （亦名si Apiasongaran）穿了一身的囚犯（農場，隊員）裝
（亦名si Apiasongaran）穿了一身的囚犯（農場，隊員）裝】

S.FORM: ka-sibo da rana, mi sia i ma-ngay ori do ma-ngato do pali-pali sio a, ka-pa-ngayo-ngayo da do dang a mi-teysa do cinai a,
S.TRANSL: 他們堂兄弟倆就一起上山去了。他們就在上面有很多蓮霧樹的那一帶砍木柴
The two cousins went up the mountains together. They went to a place up on the top where many wax apple trees were growing to cut wood.

S.FORM: ma-níring si Mikowkow am, “ana!” koan na am, “iya a, tang a, asio si Mikowkow, ta ya m-ian so sakop na ang?”
S.TRANSL: si Mikowkow喊叫了一聲“喂” ；si apen Jinovoya一聽，心想“是他（堂弟）？哼！si Mikowkow哪來的帽子？他有帽子嗎？”
Si Mikowkow finally cried out, “Hey!” As soon as si apen Jinovoya heard, he thought, “So it was him? Weird, si Mikowkow had a hat?”

S.FORM: nona, si Kaojinzhong si cia-bagbag koan ko am, ko na ji nisir-siring-i jimo am,
S.TRANSL: ‘哦，是該死的高進忠’我想，因此我就不敢再跟你說話啊！
“I thought it was that damn Kaojinzhong, and therefore I didn’t dare speak.”

S.FORM: tang a, ni-ma-teneng pa sira ni-mi, ji sia pa zikzik so asi-asisi am, kataotao a ni-t-om-agtag a ni-malayo a.
S.TRANSL: 喝！你能想像當時他們驚嚇的樣子嗎？他們停下來後，因為跑得過猛，肌肉 還不停的（顫）抖動呢
Hey, you know, they were so scared. Because they had run so hard, their muscles were twitching after they stopped.

S.FORM: ka-paka-pia da ni-ma-nanat so vele-velek nira ito a.
S.TRANSL: 那天讓他們過了一個非常的心驚肉跳的日子
That day was one that let them overly terrified.
